original_text: Two different micro-contact set-ups were used in the experiments. The asymmetrically heated measurement set-up (Fig. 2a) allows to change the contacted electrode within seconds and thereby to gain statistical information over a large number of different microelectrodes on one and the same sample in a relatively short time. It also enables monitoring of optical changes during the measurement in real time. However, the asymmetrical heating from the bottom side and local cooling (e.g. by convection, radiation, and the contacting tip acting as a heat sink) is known to cause temperature gradients within the sample [11]. Such temperature gradients are responsible for thermo-voltages, which can lead to measurement artifacts in electrochemical experiments [24]. Moreover, in this set-up temperature cycles can hardly be performed on single microelectrodes but require subsequent contacting and de-contacting of different microelectrodes.
original_translation: Se utilizaron dos configuraciones de microcontacto diferentes en los experimentos. La configuración de medición calentada asimétricamente (Fig. 2a) permite cambiar el electrodo contactado en cuestión de segundos y, de esta manera, obtener información estadística sobre un gran número de microelectrodos diferentes en una misma muestra en un tiempo relativamente corto. También permite monitorear los cambios ópticos durante la medición en tiempo real. Sin embargo, se sabe que el calentamiento asimétrico desde el lado inferior y el enfriamiento local (por convección, radiación y la punta de contacto actuando como un disipador de calor) causan gradientes de temperatura dentro de la muestra [11]. Tales gradientes de temperatura son responsables de termovoltajes, los cuales pueden provocar artefactos de medición en experimentos electroquímicos [24]. Además, en esta configuración, los ciclos de temperatura apenas se pueden realizar en microelectrodos individuales, sino que requieren el contacto y descontacto posterior de diferentes microelectrodos.
original_sentences: Two different micro-contact set-ups were used in the experiments.

The asymmetrically heated measurement set-up (Fig. 2a) allows to change the contacted electrode within seconds and thereby to gain statistical information over a large number of different microelectrodes on one and the same sample in a relatively short time.
It also enables monitoring of optical changes during the measurement in real time.

However, the asymmetrical heating from the bottom side and local cooling (e.g. by convection, radiation, and the contacting tip acting as a heat sink) is known to cause temperature gradients within the sample [11].
Such temperature gradients are responsible for thermo-voltages, which can lead to measurement artifacts in electrochemical experiments [24].
Moreover, in this set-up temperature cycles can hardly be performed on single microelectrodes but require subsequent contacting and de-contacting of different microelectrodes.

Such temperature gradients are responsible for thermo-voltages, which can lead to measurement artifacts in electrochemical experiments [24].
Moreover, in this set-up temperature cycles can hardly be performed on single microelectrodes but require subsequent contacting and de-contacting of different microelectrodes.
original_annotated_samples:
Two different
micro-contact set-ups
were used in the experiments.
translated_annotated_samples:
Dos configuraciones de
micro-contacto
diferentes fueron utilizadas en los experimentos.
micro-contact set-ups.translated_text:
Dos configuraciones de
micro-contacto
diferentes fueron utilizadas en los experimentos. La configuración de medición calentada asimétricamente (Fig. 2a) permite cambiar el electrodo contactado en cuestión de segundos y, de esta manera, obtener información estadística sobre un gran número de microelectrodos diferentes en una misma muestra en un tiempo relativamente corto. También permite monitorear los cambios ópticos durante la medición en tiempo real. Sin embargo, se sabe que el calentamiento asimétrico desde el lado inferior y el enfriamiento local (por convección, radiación y la punta de contacto actuando como un disipador de calor) causan gradientes de temperatura dentro de la muestra [11]. Tales gradientes de temperatura son responsables de termovoltajes, los cuales pueden provocar artefactos de medición en experimentos electroquímicos [24]. Además, en esta configuración, los ciclos de temperatura apenas se pueden realizar en microelectrodos individuales, sino que requieren el contacto y descontacto posterior de diferentes microelectrodos.

original_annotated_sentences: Two different micro-contact set-ups were used in the experiments.

The asymmetrically heated measurement set-up (Fig. 2a) allows to change the contacted electrode within seconds and thereby to gain statistical information over a large number of different
microelectrodes
on one and the same sample in a relatively short time.
It also enables monitoring of optical changes during the measurement in real time.

However, the asymmetrical heating from the bottom side and local cooling (e.g. by convection, radiation, and the contacting tip acting as a heat sink) is known to cause temperature gradients within the sample [11].
Such temperature gradients are responsible for thermo-voltages, which can lead to measurement artifacts in electrochemical experiments [24].

Moreover, in this set-up temperature cycles can hardly be performed on single
microelectrodes
but require subsequent contacting and de-contacting of different
microelectrodes
.
